question: Posted by Jc on July 09, 1999 at 13:14:20Hi my name is Jc  and I have had panic attacks since novemeber'98  I had gone to see so many doctors and they said I had chronic panic attacks and depression, and of cource anxiety... well just a couple of weeks ago  my NEW Doctor said I also had Diabetes(what a shock!) and also they said that Diabetes will cause Panic,Anxiety,and depression..well they switched my medications to prozac now mind you I was on paxil up to 3 weeks ago  then they switched me to prozac 20 mg   now to 40mg   (20mg in morning  then 20mg around noon)  well one morning I had a migraine headache (actually all day) that night I had gone to the emergency room(pain was overwhelming) and they gave me 75mg of demerol (on top of that I havent eaten anything all day)  got home  and slept until 4:00 in the afternoon woke up  and I felt still drugged up.  I panicked..I forgot to take my diabetes medicine  and prozac   and I took all of it at one time!  (very scary)  had a major reaction  and I really wanted to kill myself!   my husband was trying to stop me  and I actually went to the kitchen and Got the knife out!  wow  it was horrible  how I felt!   can medication really do that to you?   because I'm okay now   but then it was horrible  and I stopped my medication because of the feeling it gave!    Now what should I do!   Please help me!!!!Thanks,JcPosted by HFHS.MD-AJ on July 13, 1999 at 07:45:42Jc,It sounds like you have been struggling with different psychiatric and medical problems. Mood disorders (such as Major Depression) and anxiety disorders (such as Panic Disorder) often go hand in hand. Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitor (SSRI) medications such as Paxil and Prozac are often beneficial in the treatment of both depression and anxiety disorders. It would be highly unusual for this class of medications to make people feel like killing themselves. Suicidal ideation may however be associated with both Major depression and Panic Disorder. I am glad to hear that you are okay now. I am not sure why Paxil was discontinued and replaced with Prozac. Both have RARE reports of aggravating diabetes.I recommend that you discuss your concerns further with your treating physician/psychiatrist. You will benefit from thorough evaluation by a psychiatrist, if you are not under the care of one yet.This response is provided for general information only. Always consult your physician for any health concerns.Keywords: anxiety, panic attacks, depression, Prozac, Paxil, SSRI
title: Can medicine really make you want to kill yourself?
